text:
Waking in a Dusty Room

Raskolnikov stirs in his cluttered, dim room.  
He feels sick and irritable.

Raskolnikov: "What a wretched place!"  
Raskolnikov: "This room mirrors my mind."  
Raskolnikov: "I can't stand this anymore!"

---

A close-up of the peeling walls.  
Dust hangs thick in the air.

Raskolnikov: "I’m trapped in this prison."  
Raskolnikov: "Just me and my thoughts."  
Raskolnikov: "What’s left for me now?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov wakes up in a disheveled, oppressive room, feeling irritable and disconnected from the world around him.
